alert.note: Alert for Briscoe (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 4:54PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Briscoe County through 530 PM CDT... At 453 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Quitaque, or 9 miles southwest of Caprock Canyon State Park, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Caprock Canyon State Park and Quitaque. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
